snippet: A witnesses for the defense in the trial of Officer William G. Porter said he acted reasonably in not calling a medic for Freddie Gray, a detainee who died in April after his encounter with officers.
abstract: Lawyers for Baltimore Police Officer William G Porter present testimony of experts intended to bolster his defense and paint his actions as reasonable in not calling for medic for Freddie Gray, who died after encounter with police in April.

byline.original: By SHERYL GAY STOLBERG and JESS BIDGOOD

lead_paragraph: A witnesses for the defense in the trial of Officer William G. Porter said he acted reasonably in not calling a medic for Freddie Gray, a detainee who died in April after his encounter with officers.

headline.main: Experts Testify to Defend Baltimore Police Officer
headline.print_headline: Experts Testify to Defend Baltimore Police Officer
